links.title: Cardiologist Questions Accuracy of ECG Function in Apple Watch 4 - ExtremeTech
links.description: This site may earn affiliate commissions from the links on this page. Terms of use. Of all the features of the Apple Watch 4, probably the most-discussed is its ability to perform an electrocardiogram, or ECG. An ECG (also called an EKG) is typically performed by putting electrodes on the skin to detect the electrical changes that arise from the beating of one's heart.

links.title: Amazon just showed how serious it is about owning the smart home - and made Apple look slow
links.description: The potential reward is huge. The smart home market is expected to grow into a $53 billion industry by 2022, according to Zion Market Research. With Amazon taking an early lead in this space, it could open up a massive new revenue channel for the company going forward.

Walmart warns Trump tariffs may force price hikes

$SPY Price hikes; demand will fall like a rock! $AAPL next https://reut.rs/2PUmn8q

links.title: Walmart warns Trump tariffs may force price hikes: The Hill
links.description: (Reuters) - Walmart Inc () has issued a warning in a letter to U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer that it may have to raise prices due to tariffs on Chinese imports, CNN Money reported. "The immediate impact will be to raise prices on consumers and tax American business and manufacturers," Walmart said, according to the CNN Money report.

links.title: Apple Watch Series 4 Reviews Vary Wildly, So Here's an Aggregated Score
links.description: A wave of Apple Watch Series 4 reviews were published ahead of the Watch's September 21, 2018 on-sale date, but the variations from review to review -- predictions about its impact, whether it's worth an upgrade from Series 3, among them -- were wide. Inverse has aggregated the reviews based on a scoring system.

links.description: Westworld captivated audiences for a second season with surprising reveals, untimely deaths, and more unanswered questions. links.title: Dow Jones and S&P 500 Hit Record Highs
links.description: Wall Street Recap - The Dow Jones and S&P 500 hit record highs today. The markets notched higher as trade tensions faded. The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose +0.95% to $26,656.98, the S&P 500 rose +0.78% to $2,930.75, and the NASDAQ rose +0.98% to $8,028.23.
